title: Dragon Slayer = Shaco Nerf
body: The Dragon Slayer buff awards you with some stat boosts and a visual effect around your character given after slaying dragon. This visual effect however is a problem for Shaco as it gives a constant, easily recognisable differentiation of Shaco and his clone, this removes any of the mind games that were once possible through his ultimate. With the red and blue buffs you can just not ulti while you have it. I'm not sure if this was done purposely to force people to only be able to play ad Shaco however I am one of the few ap Shaco players and find it quite frustrating that this is only really affecting this play style of the character.

Ooh. I love this game!

**Box:** Base damage gutted, AP scaling increased, has a shorter duration (active and inactive), and fears Longer.
--- We wanted to reinforce the idea of Shaco boxes scaring the daylights out of people. So we increased the fear duration at the expense of everything else. We also shifted the damage more towards scaling, to help out the late game of AP Shaco. 

**Shiv:** Now scales on AD.
--- We wanted to give a hand to AD Shaco without nerfing AP shaco too much. Since our internal data shows the AP Shaco never bothers with this skill anyways, we decided to shift it a little.

**Flash:** When ever an enemy gets feared by a Shaco box, the cooldown on this skill is reduced by 1 second.
--- It's important that Shaco be able to maintain his high mobility stealth play. We felt this would encourage strategic use of his boxes while not affecting mobility creep in an way.

**Clone:** All damage now scales based on Bonus health.
--- We Don't really have a good reason for this, but we thought it would be funny. And at the end of the day, isn't that what Shaco is all about: Getting a good laugh?

**Passive:** The first time an Enemy see's Shaco, they gain a debuff that Causes Shaco to deal 5-20% bonus damage for 5 seconds. This ability resets after being unseen for 2 minutes.
--- We felt his old passive was too difficult to utilize for people new to Shaco. So instead, we took this opportunity to reinforce the idea of Shaco being gank happy clown.
